title: Florida woman is reunited with her beloved fox terrier 12 years after the dog disappeared
text:
A toy fox terrier that disappeared from her family's Florida home in 2007 has been reunited with her owner after she was found more than 1,000 miles from where she went missing.

The 14-year-old dog, named Dutchess, was discovered hungry and shivering under a shed in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on Monday.

The property owner took the pooch to a local Humane Animal Rescue center, where staff were able to microchip the animal and trace her to her owner, Katheryn Strang.

Strang lives in Boca Raton, Florida and was stunned to receive word that Dutchess had been discovered after more than a decade.

The devoted pet owner drove 1130 miles to Pittsburgh on Friday to be reunited with her pooch, and the heartwarming moment was captured on camera.

In the emotional video, Strang appears on the brink of tears as she lays eyes on Dutchess before taking her into her arms and cuddling her.

Katheryn Strang was reunited with her toy fox terrier Dutchess at a Humane Animal Rescue center in Pittsburgh on Friday - 12 years after the pooch vanished from their home in Florida

'I missed you so much!' Strang says before planting a kiss on Dutchess' nose.

The Florida native told reporters that she and her family were living in Orlando at he time Dutchess disappeared.

She explained that her son opened the door after returning home from school and the dog darted away.

Stang believed Dutchess may have been hit by a car, as the family home was located near a busy road.

The toy fox terrier was discovered hungry and shivering under a shed in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on Monday

'They are like your babies. You don't give up hope,' an overjoyed Strang told reporters

However, she checked local shelters every day for weeks after the pup's disappearance.

Even as the months and years passed by, Strang continued to hold out hope that she would still see her pooch again.

She continued to pay the annual fee on the microchip, as well as update her contact information whenever she moved.

'They are like your babies. You don't give up hope,' an overjoyed Strang told reporters.

It remains a mystery as to how Dutchess ended up so far from home, and how she survived for more than a decade.
description: The 14-year-old dog, named Dutchess, was discovered hungry and shivering under a shed in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on Monday.
